derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent. (as a modern Latin term in botany: see style): erroneous spelling of Latin stilus

entry.def: The stylus on a record player is the small needle that picks up the sound signals on the records.
A stylus is a device like a pen with which you can input written text or drawing directly into a computer.

example.ex: It has a stylus-operated on-screen keyboard that takes great skill to master.
example.tran: 它有触笔屏幕键盘，需要使用者掌握很高的技巧。

means.word_mean: 1. a sharp pointed device attached to the cartridge of a record player
2. a pointed tool for writing or drawing or engraving;

sentences.sentence: "he drew the design on the stencil with a steel stylus"
